intro: Mexacanthus mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in complex inflorescences. Its foliage is characterized by narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating.
